Name: Lobster Claw
Effect: When hit* the crew member will pinch the enemy for 50 damage.

Name: Shell Shield
Effect: Protects the crew member from enemy hit damage* but after each hit there’s a 33% chance it breaks.
Game Description: Old shell that's sure to withstand at least one attack.

Name: Treasure
Effect: If equipped* it opens at the end of 2 battles and grants 2 random items.
Game Description: Shiny treasure that will take a while to unlock. What will it contain?

Name: Anchor
Effect: The crew member cannot be moved from this module in battle.
Game Description: Someone doesn’t stop moving around? Tie them to this anchor.

Name: Bombs
Effect: If hit* there’s a 50% chance of -1 HP and dealing 100 damage to the enemy.
Game Description: These bombs pack a punch but harm the user too.

Name: Pirate Prosthetic Hook
Effect: Only works when not full HP. If hit by the enemy* there’s a high chance they hit the same module again. For every hit* 50% chance you receive a Tasty Seafood.
Game Description: Turn a crippled holder into a pirate that hooks onto the enemy.

Name: Drowned Islander
Effect: Makes the holder sick* but if they’re a Doctor or Scientist* after 2 battles it becomes a random crew member.
Game Description: A Doctor or Scientist might bring them back to life.

Name: Octo Ink Sack
Effect: Once per battle* if the crew member gets hit and the ship has an empty module* they avoid the hit and move to the nearest empty module.

Name: Hallucinogenic Anemone
Effect: At battle start* the holder gets a random trait until the end of that battle.
Game Description: The holder will hallucinate in every battle.

Name: Sponge
Effect: Absorbs any flooding in the module after 2 turns. If it absorbed excrement-flooding* it will poison the enemy if hit.

Name: Tasty Seafood
Effect: 1HP* single use. // also poisons the enemy?'

Name: Butchers Knife
Effect: When hit by the enemy* deal 30 damage and produce one Tasty Seafood.

Name: Ancient Coins
Effect: Can be sold at any market or emporium for a price that each shop will decide at random between 3* 4* 5* 6* 7* or 8 coins.

Name: Explosive Vest
Effect: If hit by the enemy* the brave holder dies but deals 400 damage to the enemy.

Name: Juicy Bait
Effect: The enemy has a 33% chance of targeting them with each hit.

Name: Disgusting Residue
Effect: Enemies avoid hitting the residue* but it also makes the holder sick.

Name: Barrel of Apples
Effect: +1HP/4turns* but with each apple there’s a 20% chance instead of -1HP and becoming sick.

Name: Box of Chocolates
Effect: +2HP* single use.

Name: Comfy Nappies
Effect: Absorbs any excrement-flooding and +1HP every time it does.

Name: Game Console
Effect: A crew member will pay you 3 coins for this addictive device* but -25%P. Can't be unequipped.

Name: Soap
Effect: If the module is flooded* +1HP/4turns and cures/prevents sick.

Name: Monkey Apprentice
Effect: If the holder dies* this item is consumed as they are replaced by a fully healed copy of them with the name "Mr. Monkey" and 20% less base performance.

Name: Steroids
Effect: Can't be unequipped. +1HP/4turns and +3 max HP to the holder for 5 battles* after which it's consumed.

Name: Treadmill
Effect: At the end of each battle* +1 max HP to the holder.

Name: Anti-stress Ball
Effect: The holder can't have their performance lowered* and it's prevented from becoming Lunatic.

Name: Doctor Kit
Effect: +2HP and cures sick* single use.

Name: Antidote
Effect: Prevents sick.

Name: Fishing Rod
Effect: If the module was flooded by the end of the battle* receive a Tasty Seafood.

Name: Surprise Gift
Effect: Can be any item* only known after it’s equipped and the battle starts.

Name: Enhancement Microchip
Effect: Can't be unequipped. +20%P* but if the module is flooded* -2 HP from an electric shock and the item is destroyed.

Name: Cursed Vase
Effect: At the end of each battle* -1 max HP to the holder. If they die* they return from the dead with the Doomed trait.

Name: Lifebuoy
Effect: If an adjacent crew member dies* they are rescued from the water with 2HP and this item is consumed.

Name: Telescope
Effect: If the holder was in the first column of the layout in the last battle* see what type of enemy lures in adjacent map nodes.

Name: Message in a Bottle
Effect: At the end of the battle* it's consumed to reveal a nearby node with a stranded crew member* who might be dead (30% chance) or alive (70% chance) and joins your crew.

Name: Treasure Map
Effect: At the end of each battle* it has a 40% chance of being consumed and revealing a Treasure item awaiting in a nearby node.

Name: Hip Flask
Effect: -10%P* but while the module is Set on Fire the holder gains Spits Fire as their secondary trait.

Name: Golden Tooth
Effect: Can't be unequipped. +1HP when equipped. If its holder dies* +4 coins.

Name: Goggles
Effect: The holder is immune to water-flooding and receives +10%P in a water-flooded module.

Name: Expired Sushi
Effect: +1HP* single use. But 50% chance of causing the holder to have Has Explosive Diarrhea as their secondary trait.

Name: Old Pistol
Effect: If the holder is undisturbed for 8 turns* shoots the enemy for 150 damage.

Name: Pearl
Effect: Can be crushed during a battle to heal everyone 1HP and +100 ship health* or saved for other purposes.

Name: Lost Page
Effect: 33% chance that each new item is another Lost Page* up to 5. If you have all 5 pages* consume them to build the Millennial Explorer module at the end of the battle.

Name: Summoning Rune
Effect: 33% chance that each new item is another Summoning Rune* up to 5. If you have all 5 runes* consume the runes to summon Dennis the Demon at the end of the battle.

Name: Human Skeleton
Effect: If placed in a module that’s undisturbed for 1 battle* transforms into crew member Skullo.

Name: Energy Drink
Effect: +10%P at battle start* but after 8 turns -10%P instead. Also prevents the holder from becoming Asleep.

Name: Scalpel
Effect: The holder has Amateur Surgeon as their secondary trait.

Name: Vitamin Supplements
Effect: +1HP at the end of each battle and immune to Sick.

Name: Comfy Pillow
Effect: At battle start* the holder falls asleep.

Name: Magic Wand
Effect: Every 4 turns* there’s a 16.66% chance the holder swaps places with someone else* a 16.66% chance a random module detaches from the ship* a 16.66% chance that two modules are set on fire* a 16.66% chance they heal 150 ship health* a 16.66% chance they heal 4 HP and a 16.66% chance they inflict the enemy with a random ailment.

Name: Float
Effect: The holder is not affected by a water-flooded module.

Name: Bean and Cabbage Soup
Effect: +2HP. For the next 4 battles* the holder’s secondary trait will be Uncontrollable Flatulences. Single use.

Name: Heavy Dumbbells
Effect: Can’t be unequipped. The holder can't be moved to another module. At the end of each battle* +1 max HP.

Name: Gunpowder
Effect: If the module is set on fire* during the next enemy attack to anywhere in the ship this item is consumed* -2HP to the holder and 200 damage to the enemy.

Name: Batteries
Effect: The module will charge its CD 50% faster. // This module doesn't need to be connected to energy to work.

Name: Toaster
Effect: +1HP/4turns* but if the module is water-flooded* -3HP instead and the item is destroyed.

Name: Blood Bag
Effect: If the holder loses health* after 2 turns* +1HP to a random adjacent crew member that isn't full HP.

Name: Dung Beetle
Effect: Undo excrement-flooding after 2 turns. If this happened* receive a Stinky Poo* Dry Poo* Flaming Bag of Poop* Waste Converter or Chamber Pot at the end of battle.

Name: Tool Kit
Effect: It’s consumed to change the requirements of the module at random.

Name: Medicinal Herb
Effect: Prevents all Ailments* but if the module is flooded or set on fire* it’s destroyed.

Name: University Diploma
Effect: The holder will count as having a second profession* but only as count for stacking bonus.

Name: Sacrificial Katana
Effect: A crew member in the ship can be sacrificed instantly at any moment* and if so* then this item returns at the end of the battle.

Name: Love Letter
Effect: During battle start* it's consumed and the holder and a random crew member will gain In Love as their secondary trait.

Name: Suspicious Magazines
Effect: The holder has their traits changed to Chronic Masturbator and Porn Addict.

Name: Lucky Pants
Effect: If the holder or their module gets an unlucky roll* roll again.

Name: Saw-in-half Box
Effect: At the end of the battle* 40% chance the holder is cut in half and dies and you get the item back* and 60% chance you gain a duplicate of the crew member* after which the item is gone.

Name: Violin of Death
Effect: +40%P* but at the end of each battle* there’s a 20% chance the holder dies.

Name: Sack of Cement
Effect: If the module is water-flooded* this item is consumed and the holder cannot be moved from its module ever again* but +3/HP and +3 max HP.

Name: Starfish Shurikens
Effect: If the module is water-flooded* every 4 turns the holder will throw starfish shurikens at the enemy dealing 100 damage.

Name: Harp of Life
Effect: Once per battle* if the holder is about to die* they will fully heal instead* but the enemy will also heal 400 HP.

Name: Ultra-sensory Blindfold
Effect: -40%P* however* the holder will have a 75% chance of dodging enemy damage.

Name: Blood Extraction
Effect: If the holder lost health this battle* +50 ship health. If the holder died* the item is gone but +150 ship health.

Name: Penetrating Maggots
Effect: Can’t be unequipped. The holder becomes Sick* however if they die* they return from the dead with the trait Reanimated.

Name: Pendant of Cursed Water
Effect: This item must be equipped as long as you have a crew member. -2 max HP. If the crew member dies* Cursed Water returns to your inventory.

Name: Notice of Termination
Effect: Allows you to fire a crew member; -20%P at battle start* and at the end of batle they leave and a random crew member will replace them.

Name: Salary Increase
Effect: +10%P* but -5%P to all adjacent crew members that don’t hold Salary Increase.

Name: Electric Kit
Effect: At the start of battle* randomly changes the energy pattern of its module and it's consumed.

Name: Delicate Scorpion Tank
Effect: If the module is hit* 50% chance the holder loses 1 HP and 50% chance the enemy loses 100 HP.

Name: Recipe Book
Effect: If undisturbed* produce food at the end of the battle: 25% Tasty Seafood* 25% Tasty Pizza* 25% Box of Chocolates* 25% Expired Sushi.

Name: Bucket
Effect: If this module is flooded* you can flood any adjacent modules instead.

Name: Reckless Enhancer
Effect: Can’t be unequipped. +20%P and +3 max HP* but after 3 battles* the holder gains Doomed as their secondary trait.

Name: Cup of Hot Coffee
Effect: +1HP at the end of each battle (can increase max HP)* but every time the holder is disturbed* they scald themselves and -1HP instead.

Name: Irresistible Nectar
Effect: If the holder is hit by the enemy* this item is consumed and the enemy will attack the same module for its next 4 attacks.

Name: Holiday Tickets
Effect: Every 2 turns there’s a 5% chance the holder disappears. They will return after 2 battles with +10% base performance* fully healed and with +1 max HP* after which this item is consumed.

Name: Military Propaganda
Effect: At the end of every battle* the holder has a 50% chance of becoming a cadet* after which it's consumed.

Name: Pipe and Monocle
Effect: The holder has the Posh Millionaire trait.

Name: All-muscle Juice
Effect: -30%P* but +1HP/4turns and +1 max HP.

Name: Stinky Poo
Effect: This module is excrement-flooded and -5%P to adjacent crew members. If hit by the enemy* it's inflicted with Poison.

Name: Shoddy Toilet
Effect: If hit* produces a Stinky Poo* Dry Poo* Flaming Bag of Poop* Waste Converter or Chamber Pot but 33% chance that the toilet breaks.

Name: Malevolent Mask
Effect: Can’t be unequipped. The holder will attack nearby crew members every 4 turns for -1HP. If a crew member dies from one of these attacks* they return with the Reanimated trait.

Name: Precious Ring
Effect: Can’t be unequipped. +1HP/4turns* however adjacent crew members will attack the holder for -1HP every 4 turns* with a 25% chance of swapping items.

Name: Fossil
Effect: If disturbed* it breaks. If undisturbed for a whole battle in a scientific module or held by a scientist or biologist* it turns into a random Organic A module.

Name: Maracas of Insanity
Effect: Can’t be unequipped. After every battle* +5%P but -1 max HP unless the holder has 1 max HP.

Name: Make-a-submarine Kit
Effect: If undisturbed for a battle* it turns into a random 4* 6 or 8-cost module* depending on whether the holder had less than 60%P* more than 60%P or more than 80% respectively.

Name: Magic Trousers
Effect: The holder can't die* but they also move to a random adjacent module every 4 turns.

Name: Vampire Fangs
Effect: If the holder isn’t max HP* every 4 turns they will steal 1 HP from an adjacent crew member.

Name: Lifesteal Dagger
Effect: If the holder is going to die* instead of dying they murder a random adjacent crew member instead.

Name: Mind Controller
Effect: Can’t be unequipped. When equipped* change the holder’s trait to another trait in your ship of your choice.

Name: Teleport Pads
Effect: When equipped* a second Teleport Pads appears. Once per battle* you can swap around crew members with Teleport pads.

Name: Umbilical Cord
Effect: Can’t be unequipped. When equipped* designate another holder* they will also receive Umbilical Cord. The HP of both holders of Umbilical Cord will be averaged.

Name: Mutational Gills
Effect: If the holder is in a water-flooded module* +1HP/4turns* if they’re in an excrement-flooded module* -1HP/4turns.

Name: Leading Drums
Effect: Won't have any effects regarding performance* including DPT* but +10%P to each adjacent crew member.

Name: Egg
Effect: If disturbed* it breaks. If undisturbed for one battle* it hatches and you receive the crew member Vicious Dinosaur.

Name: Ticking Time Bomb
Effect: Every 2 turns it's swapped to a random adjacent crew member. At turn 10 it explodes and -5HP to its holder. If an enemy hit lands onto the holder* the item is consumed and the enemy will suffer an explosion of 300 damage at turn 10.
Game Description: No one wants to hold a ticking time bomb* better get rid of it before it explodes.

Name: Flaming Bag of Poop
Effect: It automatically passes from one crew member to another* no matter how far away from eachother. If hit by the enemy* it’s destroyed dealing 100 damage* burning the enemy and setting the module on fire.

Name: Jar of Farts
Effect: If hit by the enemy* it's destroyed dealing 50 damage. For every other crew member that held this item* the damage is increased by 50. // Poisons the enemy?

Name: Fire Extinguisher
Effect: Prevents this and adjacent modules from being set on fire.

Name: Brain-preserving Parasite
Effect: Can’t be unequipped. If the holder dies* this item is consumed and you gain Extra Brain.

Name: Brain-absorbing Parasite
Effect: Can’t be unequipped. If the holder has a performance gain* instead it turns into +1HP/4turns* and if it has a second performance gain* +1HP/2turns.

Name: Forwards Time Machine
Effect: At battle start* the holder will disappear and travel to the future. They will return after 2 battles full HP but with Centenarian as their secondary trait* and you will know the contents of a hunge amount of nodes down below.

Name: Hacking Peripheral
Effect: The module that this item is in will have no requirements.

Name: Crystal Ball
Effect: If undisturbed during battle* will foresee the contents of a few nodes down below.

Name: Item Magnet
Effect: If you receive or buy an item* there's a 50% chance it comes with another item.

Name: 3D Printer
Effect: If undisturbed for one battle* gain a random bad quality item that will last for 1 battle.

Name: Lobster Tank
Effect: If undisturbed for a battle* produce one Lobster claw* but if the module is flooded* this item is destroyed and -2 HP.

Name: Superhero Cape
Effect: Can’t be unequipped. When equipped* the holder’s secondary trait has an 80% chance of changing to Geek* and a 20% chance of changing to Hero Mindset.

Name: Acid Lemons
Effect: +1HP and the holder gains Constipated as their secondary trait* single use.

Name: Ship in a Bottle
Effect: Sells for 2 coins.

Name: Frozen Explorer
Effect: If set on fire* it turns into a random crew member.

Name: Rubik Cube
Effect: -40%P* but at the end of each battle there’s a 20% chance the item disappears and the holder’s trait becomes Genius.

Name: Shopping Bag
Effect: If this item was held during a battle* at the start of the next market or emporium* you lose 1 coin and gain a random item.

Name: Brain-enhancing Beetle
Effect: +2%P after every battle* but the holder will die if they stop holding this item.

Name: Little Oyster
Effect: After 3 battles* this item is consumed and Little Oyster swims away* leaving behind either a Pearl or a Corrupted Pearl.

Name: Corrupted Pearl
Effect: Can’t be unequipped. -1HP/4turns* but if they survive for 2 battles* Corrupted Pearl turns into Pearl.

Name: Magic Shoes
Effect: +10%P/4 turns* but the holder moves to a random adjacent module every 4 turns.

Name: Intelligence Reverser
Effect: Reverses any performance gains and losses of its holder.

Name: Extra Brain
Effect: Can’t be unequipped. The holder has a performance cap of 150.

Name: Marine Disguise
Effect: If the holder is targeted by the enemy* 100% chance the enemy targets another crew member instead* but every subsequent targeting of the holder the chance is reduced -25% each time. If Marine Disguise is hit* it's consumed and the enemy heals 100 HP.

Name: Devil’s Pact
Effect: After 1 battle* the item is consumed and the holder gains +20%P* fully heal and +3 max HP* however* every enemy hit will have a 33% chance of targeting the holder.

Name: Brainwasher
Effect: Can’t be unequipped. At battle start a random adjacent crew member brainwashes the holder into having their same trait for the duration of the battle.

Name: Mindless Potion
Effect: -10%P and the holder's trait doesn't have any effect.

Name: Welcome Mat
Effect: New recruits will have +10%P for their first battle if adjacent to its holder.

Name: Little Robohelper
Effect: +20%P and the holder's profession counts as two for stacking bonus. Destroyed if flooded.

Name: Personal Diary
Effect: Can't be unequipped. If the first holder dies* this item returns* and whoever holds it next will have the same profession and traits as the original holder.

Name: Slot Machine
Effect: -70%P. You lose 1 coin at battle start* and if so* there’s a 10% chance at the end of each battle that you receive 14* 16* 18 or 20 coins.

Name: Football
Effect: Every 2 turns it’s passed to a random adjacent crew member gaining momentum with every pass. If the enemy hits the ball* it's launched at its face dealing 100 damage for each time the ball moved and then the item is consumed.

Name: Water Tap
Effect: You can choose to water-flood this module at any moment.

Name: Lighter
Effect: You can choose to set this module on fire at any moment.

Name: Tasty Pizza
Effect: +1HP* single use.

Name: Enchanted Wood
Effect: If the module is set on fire* this item is consumed and this module becomes permanently set on magic fire that doesn't harm the occupant and can't be removed with other module elements or statuses.

Name: Module Repair Kit
Effect: If this or an adjacent module becomes damage* it fixes it* once per battle.

Name: Christmas Tree
Effect: After every battle* 50% chance you receive a Surprise Gift. Destroyed if flooded or set on fire.

Name: Whip
Effect: The holder whips an adjacent crew member to the left* causing them -1HP/4turns but +5%P with each hit.

Name: Deck of Magic Cards
Effect: At the end of 9/7/5/3/1 battles (for 0-10/20-30/40-50/60-70/80-100%P) it's consumed and the holder becomes a Wizard.

Name: Book of the Dead
Effect: At battle start* this item is consumed and the holder will have their trait changed to Necromancy Enthusiast* Bone Architect* Corpse Looter or Frankenstein Fan.

Name: Normal Pills
Effect: At the end of the battle* this item is consumed and the holder's trait permanently changes to Normal.

Name: Dangerous Chainsword
Effect: If hit* will deal 100 damage to the enemy* but there’s also a 33% chance of -1HP* the item is destroyed and the holder's trait changes to Missing an Arm and a Leg.

Name: Chamber Pot
Effect: The amount of poo in the pot increases for every different crew member that has ever held this item. If hit by the enemy* cause poisoning and deal 50 damage for each different crew member that held this item.

Name: Pen and Paper
Effect: If the holder has 60%P or more and is undisturbed* at the end of the battle there’s a 50% chance they produce Recipe Book (0-10)* Book of the Dead (11-20)* Ancient Volume of Wisdom (21-30)* Lost Page (31-40)* Treasure Map (41-50)* Love Letter (51-60)* Suspicious Magazines (61-70)* Military Propaganda (71-80)* Notice of Termination (81-90) or University Diploma (91-100).

Name: Waste Converter
Effect: If this module becomes excrement-flooded* undo the flooding after 2 turns and produce one Tasty Seafood* Tasty Pizza* Acid Lemons or Box of Chocolates.

Name: Sacrificial Altar
Effect: If the holder is adjacent to 4 crew members and one of them is about to die* the holder dies instead and Sacrificial Altar is consumed.
Game Description: They will lie on the altar waiting for their moment to come* blessed knowing that their life will be given for the cause.

Name: Impossibly Stacked Stones
Effect: If this module is disturbed* this item is destroyed. After 2 battles undisturbed* this item is consumed and you gain the crew member Golem Helper.

Name: Most Loyal Companion
Effect: Can’t be unequipped. Every time the holder is about to take damage* instead it’s blocked by Most Loyal Companion* but with every block this item has a 25% chance of being destroyed.

Name: Donation Jar
Effect: At the end of battle* this item is consumed and grants you coins equal to the added performance in the last turn of the battle of the holder and all adjacent crew members* divided by 60.
Game Description: At the end of the battle* it's consumed and receive more coins the better nearby donors performend.

Name: Ultimate Reconstructor
Effect: At battle start this item is consumed* you heal 600 ship health and this module becomes unstable for the rest of the battle* meaning there's a 25% chance every 2 turns that it explodes.

Name: Unstable Rocket
Effect: At turn 2* launch a rocket that deals 300 damage to the enemy* this item is consumed and its module becomes unstable for the rest of the battle* meaning there's a 25% chance every 2 turns that it explodes.

Name: Unstable Booster
Effect: +20%P but the module the holder is in will be unstable* meaning there's a 25% chance every 2 turns that it explodes.

Name: Dry Poo
Effect: If this module is flooded* Dry Poo turns into Stinky Poo.

Name: Diarrhea Gun
Effect: If this module is excrement-flooded* deal 30dpt to the enemy.

Name: Reckless On Button
Effect: The module will be active* but if it doesn't meet its requirements* it will be unstable and have a 25% chance of exploding every 2 turns.

Name: Frozen Chest
Effect: If set on fire* it turns into a random item.

Name: Backwards Time Machine
Effect: At battle start the holder will travel to the past* and will return after 2 battles with 1 HP but together with a random crew member that died before the activation of this item* and then this item is consumed.

Name: Module Booster
Effect: Grants its module another random side effect.

Name: Technology Warper
Effect: At battle start* the holder’s module will be randomised.

Name: Personality Warper
Effect: At battle start* the holder’s profession and traits will be randomised.

Name: Ship Expansion
Effect: If available* gain two extra empty slots adjacent to this one.

Name: Mask of the Concealed
Effect: -20%P* but the holder won’t be targeted by the enemy. If this item is separated from its holder* they die.

Name: Gift Voucher
Effect: Can be sold in a market or emporium for 0 coins* and then a random module or applicant of this shop will be on sale for 0 coins.

Name: Gamepad
Effect: You can move one crew member to an adjacent module once per battle.

Name: Lucky Baby
Effect: -20%P. If the holder dies* this item is inherited by a random crew member. After 2 battles* this item transforms into a random Cadet crew member.

Name: Calming Spray
Effect: If the holder is hit by the enemy it will deal 33% less ship damage in their next attack.

Name: Wheelchair
Effect: +10%P to the holder if they have 4 or less HP.

Name: Emergency Lifesucker
Effect: If your ship runs out of HP* survive while you have crew members alive* but every turn 2 random crew members die prioritising the holder last* and this item is consumed at the end of battle.

Name: Alternative Chip
Effect: The module that this item is in will have a different side effect.

Name: Temporary Boost
Effect: Grants its module another random side effect* but it's consumed at the end of battle.

Name: Temporary Hack
Effect: Eliminates the requirements of the module it's in* but it's consumed at the end of battle.

Name: Tranquiliser Dart
Effect: If the holder is undisturbed for 6 turns* throw a dart that puts the enemy to sleep.

Name: Cooking Hobs
Effect: If hit by the enemy* deal 50 damage and produce 1 Tasty Seafood. If hit twice by the enemy* inflict burn.

Name: Swinging Watch
Effect: If in the leftmost column and undisturbed for 4 turns* puts the enemy to sleep.

Name: Flashbang
Effect: If hit by the enemy* -30%P* the enemy is blinded and this item is consumed.

Name: Bath Salts
Effect: If this module is flooded* +1HP/4turns.

Name: Taming Fish Food
Effect: Every 4 turns* throw fish food at the enemy that heals it for 50 HP* but also reduces its dpt by 10.

Name: Perfect On Button
Effect: The module will be active regardless of requirements.

Name: Sticky Bomb
Effect: If hit by the enemy* this item is consumed* and in 4 turns* it will explode dealing 200 damage to the enemy.

Name: Water Gun
Effect: If this module is flooded* shoot 20dpt at the enemy.

Name: Magic Mirror
Effect: At the end of combat* this item is consumed and if the holder was undisturbed* gain an exact copy of that crew member* or if disturbed the holder simply becomes Lunatic.

Name: Item Rematerialiser
Effect: Any items placed in the same module as this one will change to other random items at the end of the battle.

Name: Artifact Booster
Effect: Adjacent modules with items in them have +10%P.

Name: Technology Absorber
Effect: Any items placed in the same module as this one will be consumed at battle start to heal 300 ship health.

Name: Submarine Builder
Effect: At the end of the battle* this item is consumed and you gain a random module of the same type as the module this item was placed in.

Name: Intelligent Autopilot
Effect: This item can be placed in a module without an occupant and it becomes automatised.

Name: Mysterious Ashes
Effect: It transforms into a crew member depending on what module element triggers the transformation. Flooding: Mud Golem* set on fire: Phoenixman* freezing: Ice Empress* wild: Ancient Ent. // Now only 2 elements* RIP Ice Empress and Ancient Ent.

Name: Deep Connection
Effect: When equipped* another Deep Connection will be equipped to a random crew member. They can't be unequipped. When together* their performance can't be lowered and they can't suffer ailments* but if they're ever separated* they both die.

Name: Divine Immunity
Effect: When equipped* another Deep Connection will be equipped to a random crew member. They can't be unequipped. When together* their performance can't be lowered and they can't suffer ailments* but if they're ever separated* they both die.

Name: Eject Button
Effect: Activate to eject this module and its occupant away from the battle into a node further down* even in response to an incoming enemy attack.

Name: Irresistible Bait Escape
Effect: Activaste to consume this item* throwing it at the enemy to distract them while you escape the battle. However* that particular enemy will grow stronger from the food and will be sure to reappear later with increased strength.

Name: Unsustainable Brain
Effect: +20%P* -1HP/4turns.

Name: Bedrock Disintegrator
Effect: Eliminate a non-boss adjacent map node* and the nodes adjacent to the eliminated node will become direct paths* after which this item is consumed.

Name: Stacking Bonus Marker
Effect: Stacking Bonus Marker

Name: Aloe Vera Cream
Effect: The holder is immune to Set on Fire.

Name: Fuel Converter
Effect: If this module was flooded* 50% chance of producing 1 Fuel at the end of the battle.

Name: Shower of Cold Water
Effect: -3HP at batlte start* but at the end of battle the occupier is healed back to full HP. // But +1HP/2turns. The former option promotes battling quickly* the latter* stretching out the battle to heal up more.

Name: Contaminated Medical Kit
Effect: At battle start* 50% chance of +1HP* 50% chance of -1HP.

Name: Cursed Book of Revival
Effect: If the holder dies* 50% chance they revive to full HP* 50% chance a random adjacent crew member also dies* and this item returns to the bench.

Name: Hologram Projector
Effect: All adjacent modules count as manned by 30% base performance crew members of no profession or trait.

Name: Brain Swapper
Effect: The occupant swaps their performance with the crew member adjacent to the left.

Name: Health Swapper 1
Effect: If an adjacent crew member loses/gains HP* the holder loses/gains the HP instead.

Name: Health Swapper 2
Effect: If the holder loses/gains HP* a random adjacent crew member loses/gains the HP instead.

Name: Health Swapper 3
Effect: If an adjacent crew member loses/gains HP* the holder loses/gains the HP too.

Name: Health Swapper 4
Effect: If the holder loses/gains HP* a random adjacent crew member loses/gains the HP too.

Name: Lightning Rod
Effect: Every 2 turns there's a 50% chance lightning strikes the module* charging it up with energy regardless of its energy pattern* but the holder suffers -1HP.

Name: Electricity Absorber
Effect: If this module is adjacent to 4 modules with energy* it'll have its own energy.

Name: High-Voltage Blaster
Effect: Only works if this module is connected to the energy grid* but this module won't have any energy left for itself and will be inactive. +10dpt.

Name: Fusion Generator
Effect: This and all adjacent modules have energy without being connected to the energy grid.
